IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Narcolepsy Network is dedicated to improving the lives of people with narcolepsy. Goals include: increasing public awareness, advocating and providing education and resources for people with narcolepsy, promoting and supporting narcolepsy and related research.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The purposes for which the corporation is organized are: educate the public about narcolepsy, support individuals with narcolepsy, promote efficient diagnosis, encourage and promote scientific research for cause, treatments, prevention and cure of narcolepsy, provide for the formation of Chapters, provide funding through solicitation and fund-raising activities for the above-mentioned purposes.
IRS990.Desc: CONFERENCE: Each year Narcolepsy Network (NN) hosts a conference in a different city, which creates a unique gathering for, support, education, awareness building, and networking among people affected by narcolepsy. A selection of workshops, lectures, support forums, energizers and creative activities are some of the offerings at the conference. Graduate students and professionals in health, education, science and government can get a unique perspective on narcolepsy and the effect it has on individuals and families. In 2015, NN hosted the 30th annual conference in Minneapolis, MN. Nearly 450 people with narcolepsy and their supporters attended from all over the world. The conference offered special programming for children and young adults with narcolepsy as well as sessions on research treatment and advocacy. The annual membership meeting was held at the conference and NN presented awards to one researcher. In addition, a new Youth Ambassador program was launched during the 2015 annual conference.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PUBLIC INFORMATION: Information provided for public, academic, medical, and other persons interested in obtaining information about narcolepsy, its causes, symptoms and treatments. Creation and distribution of educational materials and brochures, maintenance of website, interactive forum discussion and social media outreach. NN's Facebook and Twitter pages, with more than 6,000 followers, and an active Facebook support group with nearly 5,000 members continued to bring narcolepsy news and information to people around the world. Fun awareness events continued, including The New York Dream Big Walk, which had more than 145 walkers raise awareness along the Hudson River in New York City. The Third Annual Narcolepsy Bed Race in Virginia also reached more than 60,000 in Southwest Virginia. Narcolepsy Network continued outreach to healthcare providers and educators in 2015, including an initiative to educate medical professionals with two posters that were presented at the SLEEP 2015 meeting, which is attended, by approximately 5,000 sleep professionals. A Youth Ambassador program to support youth with Narcolepsy.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: NEWSLETTER, MEMBERSHIP & SCHOLARSHIPS: Our quarterly newsletter, "The Network" is for many people the only source of information about narcolepsy. The newsletter is distributed to the membership as well as many non-member sleep centers and professionals. Each newsletter provides information on diagnosis, effective treatments, resources, updates detailing new narcolepsy research, ideas for coping, personal stories and interviews, industry news, legal and insurance guidance and much more. Approximately 2,000 newsletters are printed quarterly. As part of its mission to provide support to people with narcolepsy, Narcolepsy Network encourages the formation of support groups. There are more than 30 active in-person groups in the U.S. Approximately 30 full and partial membership, and 25 conference scholarships were provided to members in need.

CollectionUsedOtherPurposesGrp.OtherPurposesDesc: use image on merchandise to further awareness

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Maureen D Garnier donated "The Dream", her original watercolor with black and metallic inks. The painting measures 26" x 39". "The Dream" may be used in a variety of print images to further awareness of narcolepsy and its symptoms.

The organization has adopted the accounting standard related to uncertainty in income taxes. For the periods ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 respectively, the organization did not identify any uncertain tax positions taken in an income tax return that would require adjustment to or disclosure in its financial statements. In addition, the organization believes that its tax status as a tax exempt entity would be sustained under federal and state tax examination. The organization is subject to federal and state tax examination for three years.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Family Retreat Grant for families with children with narcolepsy

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: Financial assistance to attend the annual conference

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Need based scholarships to Annual Conference. Includes travel assistance to conference. Receipts required for reimbursement after travel takes place.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Narcolepsy Network is a membership organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Any person who supports the purpose of the corporation may become a member for each calendar year by paying the annual membership dues as required by the bylaws. Only those persons whose dues are current or have been granted complimentary membership shall be eligible to vote at membership meetings. There shall be no membership certificates of this corporation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Any member may attend a membership meeting. Voting privileges shall be extended to any member whose dues are paid by the close of business on the day prior to giving notice of the meeting, which shall be the record date for determining the members entitled to vote at the meeting. Each voting member shall have one (1) vote. Membership standing in the name of a corporation may be voted on by any officer or agent, or by proxy appointed by any of them, unless some other person, by resolution of its board or pursuant to its bylaws, shall be appointed to vote the membership.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees shall be called to review the annual Form 990 and accompanying schedules.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All Board members are provided conflict of interest forms and asked to signed a statement of compliance. The President then follows up with each board member by email or phone until they were returned.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Narcolepsy Network governing documents, including the conflict of interest policy, are available to the public upon request. The financial statements are published in the Narcolepsy Network Annual Report, which is available on the Narcolepsy Network website. Additionally, the bylaws are on the Narcolepsy Network website member's only section and are available upon request.
Conference Event Planning $13,880, Youth Ambassador Consulting $7,450, Editing & Design Services $2,640, Administrative Services $500
